thread.title: ‘If you panic, you look like prey’
thread.title_full: ‘If you panic, you look like prey’

title: ‘If you panic, you look like prey’
text:
Sunday Night reporter Rahni Sadler describes the swim that changed her mind about sharks Rahni Sadler news.com.au Sunday Night reporter Rahni Sadler describes the swim that changed her mind about sharks Rahni Sadler news.com.au On Sunday Night: Rahni Sadler swims with sharks 0:17 
Courtesy: Channel Seven. a day ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/TV/ 
IF ANYONE had told me that one day I’d be underwater watching a huge tiger shark swim so close I could touch it, I’d have called them mad. 
I’m terrified of sharks, absolutely, utterly terrified. 
Always have been, like anyone who has ever seen Jaws . 
As a long time ocean swimmer and surfer, I’ve spent inordinate hours thinking of strategies to avoid sharks and how I would respond if my Mick Fanning moment ever came. 
So embarking on a trip where we’d deliberately come face to face with sharks, some of the most dangerous in the world, would not long ago have seemed beyond ludicrous. 
It started out as research for a story on the awful attacks that have been taking place on the north coast of New South Wales. I set about reading everything I could on shark behaviour and the potential causes of attacks. Other Stories
